meanings.definition: A small, representative system having analogies to a larger system.
meanings.sent1: In our school, the student council acts as a microcosmoses of our government.
meanings.sent2: The ant colony can be seen as a microcosmoses of a bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a microcosmoses of chaos when the food fight started.
meanings.sent4: The snow globe was like a tiny microcosmoses of a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The dollhouse was a perfect microcosmoses of a real home, complete with tiny furniture and decorations.

meanings.definition: A community, place, or situation regarded as encapsulating in miniature the characteristics of something much larger.
meanings.sent1: The small village was a microcosmoses of the bustling city nearby.
meanings.sent2: The pet store was a microcosmoses of the diverse ecosystem found in the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The children's playdate turned into a microcosmoses of a busy marketplace with all their trading toys.
meanings.sent4: The snow globe was like a tiny microcosmoses of a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The dollhouse was a perfect microcosmoses of a real home, complete with tiny furniture and decorations.
